Text: I lift up my eyes to the mountains—where does my help come from?
Context: The psalmist expresses a searching or questioning attitude, looking towards the mountains possibly as a metaphor for challenges or a source of aid.

Text: My help comes from the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth.
Context: A clear statement of faith and reliance on the LORD as the ultimate helper and creator, dismissing any dependence on the mountains or earthly powers.

Text: He will not let your foot slip—He who watches over you will not slumber;
Context: God is presented as a vigilant protector who will prevent missteps and is always alert.

Text: Indeed, He who watches over Israel will neither slumber nor sleep.
Context: The psalmist emphasizes the unwavering vigilance of God over His people, Israel, providing comfort through His constant presence.

Text: The LORD watches over you—the LORD is your shade at your right hand;
Context: The LORD is portrayed as a personal guardian providing protection and comfort in a metaphor akin to a shade from the sun.

Text: The sun will not harm you by day, nor the moon by night.
Context: Extending the metaphor of protection, the psalm uses day and night to signify God’s perpetual safeguarding.

Text: The LORD will keep you from all harm—He will watch over your life;
Context: A strong declaration of God‘s protective nature over the entirety of one’s being and life circumstances.

Text: The LORD will watch over your coming and going both now and forevermore.
Context: The chapter concludes with a broad and enduring promise of God‘s ever-present watchfulness in all aspects of life.
